meta.@content:
Camera, CameraShot and CameraMovement prototypes that demonstrate storyboard
capabilities and precise camera operation. This is a developmental effort for potential
X3D Specification improvement.
Schematron rules, backed up by initialize() checks
Camera nodes for Viewpoint navigation control

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo:
Camera node provides direct control of scene view to enable cinematic
camera animation shot by shot and move by move along with still digital-photography
settings for offline rendering of camera images.

field.@appinfo: Text description to be displayed for this Camera

Camera position in local transformation frame, which is default prior
to first CameraShot initialPosition getting activated

Camera rotation in local transformation frame, which is default prior
to first CameraShot initialPosition getting activated
pi/4
input fraction drives interpolators
input event binds or unbinds this Camera
output event indicates when this Camera is bound
output event indicates whether this Camera is bound or unbound
Vector distance to near clipping plane corresponds to NavigationInfo.avatarSize[0]
Vector distance to far clipping plane corresponds to NavigationInfo.visibilityLimit
Array of CameraShot nodes which in turn contain CameraMovement nodes
Whether camera headlight is on or off
Camera headlight color
Camera headlight intensity
Camera filter color that modifies virtual lens capture
Camera filter transparency that modifies virtual lens capture
upVector changes modify camera orientation (and possibly vice versa)

Focal length divided effective aperture diameter indicating width of focal
plane
Distance to focal plane of sharpest focus

Mark start/stop with true/false output respectively useful to trigger
external animations

Total duration of contained enabled CameraShot (and thus CameraMovement)
move durations
OfflineRender node
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress

node reference to permit getting setting fields from within Script
node reference to permit getting setting fields from within Script
node reference to permit getting setting fields from within Script
key array for interpolators
keyValue array for PositionInterpolator
keyValue array for OrientationInterpolator

whether internal CameraShot and CameraMove nodes are tracking or changed
via ROUTE events
perform checkShots() function once immediately after initialization
how many CameraShot nodes are contained in shots array
how many CameraMove nodes are contained in moves array
how many frames were created in current loop
holding variable
holding variable
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress

#sourceCode: "    // remaining setups deferred to invocation of checkShots() method

"    // thanks to Yvonne Jung Fraunhofer for diagnosing better approach to function
initialization

"    tracePrint ('checkShots() method should only occur after initialize() methods
in all other Scripts are complete');

"    // compute totalDuration by summing durations from contained CameraShot and
CameraMovement nodes
"    for (i = 0; i < shotCount; i++) // shots index

"          alwaysPrint ('warning: CameraShot[' + i + '][' + shots[i].description
+ '] has no contained CameraMove nodes');

"       alwaysPrint ('warning: no CameraShot nodes found for the shots, nothing
to do!');

"       alwaysPrint ('warning: no CameraMove nodes found for the shots, nothing
to do!');
"       alwaysPrint ('warning: totalDuration = 0 seconds, nothing to do!');
"    tracePrint ('number of contained CameraShot nodes=' + shotCount);
"    tracePrint ('number of contained CameraMove nodes=' + movesCount);

"    tracePrint ('totalDuration=' + totalDuration + ' seconds for all shots and
moves');
"    var k = 0; // index for latest key, keyValuePosition, keyValueOrientation
"    for (i = 0; i < shotCount; i++) // shots index

"        else     // new shot repositions, reorients camera as clean break from
preceding shot/move
"           key[k+1]                 = key[k]; // start from end from previous move
"        for (j = 0; j < shots[i].moves.length; j++) // moves index

"            var durationFloat =              shots[i].moves[j].duration;  // implicit
type conversion from SFTime

"            //  durationFloat = new SFFloat (shots[i].moves[j].duration); // explicit
type conversion from SFTime
"                // using constructor SFRotation (SFVec3f fromVector, SFVec3f toVector)

"                // see X3D ECMAScript binding Table 7.18 â€” SFRotation instance
creation functions
"                // test if difference vector is zero, if so maintain previous rotation
"                    // default view direction is along -Z axis
"            k++; // update index to match latest key, keyValuePosition, keyValueOrientation

"            // check animated parameter:  set true if any of moves are tracking
moves

"            if (!animated)  animated = shots[i].moves[j].tracking; // once true,
remains true

"         // tracePrint ('shots[' + i + '].moves[' + j + '].tracking=' + shots[i].moves[j].tracking
+ ', animated=' + animated);
"      alwaysPrint ('warning: internal error during array construction, ' +
"      alwaysPrint ('warning: internal error during array construction, ' +
"      alwaysPrint ('warning: internal error during array construction, ' +

"    // some browsers add brackets to array output strings, this function strips
them

"function set_fraction (eventValue, timestamp) // input event received for inputOnly
field
"   // if Camera is being animated, immediately recompute interpolator settings
"   // trace progress on console with reduced output frequency

"        // TODO how to report or speed up response?  alwaysPrint ('  aimPoint='
+ aimPoint.toString());
"   else if ((timestamp - priorTraceTime) >= 1.0) // 1 second trace interval

"        // TODO how to report or speed up response?  alwaysPrint ('  aimPoint='
+ aimPoint.toString());

"      // note that zero value is not necessarily sent first by TimeSensor, so otherwise
ignored

"        // TODO how to report or speed up response?  alwaysPrint ('  aimPoint='
+ aimPoint.toString());

"      // do not unbind the Viewpoint and NavigationInfo nodes, let that be controlled
externally
"function set_bind (eventValue) // input event received for inputOnly field
"   // need to ensure CameraShot nodes are properly initialized
"function set_description (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput field
"function set_position (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput field
"function set_orientation (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput field
"function set_fieldOfView (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput field

"function set_nearClipPlane (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput
field

"function set_farClipPlane (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput
field
"function set_shots (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput field
"function set_filterColor (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput field

"function set_filterTransparency (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput
field
"function set_upVector (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput field
"function set_fStop (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput field

"function set_focusDistance (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput
field

"function set_offlineRender (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput
field
"function set_key (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput field

"function set_keyValuePosition (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput
field

"function set_keyValueOrientation (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput
field
"function set_animated (eventValue) // input event received for inputOutput field

"    // try to ensure outputValue is converted to string despite Browser.println
idiosyncracies

"    var outputString = outputValue.toString(); // utility function according to
spec
"    if (outputString == null) outputString = outputValue; // direct cast

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo:
CameraShot collects a specific set of CameraMovement animations that make
up an individual shot.

field.@appinfo: Text description to be displayed for this CameraShot
Whether this CameraShot can be activated
Set of CameraMovement nodes
Setup to reinitialize camera position for this shot
Setup to reinitialize camera rotation for this shot

Setup to reinitialize aimpoint (relative location for camera direction)
for this shot
pi/4

Focal length divided effective aperture diameter indicating width of focal
plane
Distance to focal plane of sharpest focus
Subtotal duration of contained CameraMovement move durations

Mark start/stop with true/false output respectively useful to trigger
external animations
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress

for this shot

plane

external animations
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress

keyValue array for PositionInterpolator
keyValue array for OrientationInterpolator

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo:
CameraMovement node defines a single camera movement animation including
goalPosition, goalOrientation, goalAimPoint and goalFieldOfView.

field.@appinfo: Text description to be displayed for this CameraMovement
Whether this CameraMovement can be activated
Duration in seconds for this move
Goal camera position for this move
Goal camera rotation for this move
Whether or not camera direction is tracking towards the aimPoint
Goal aimPoint for this move, ignored if tracking=false
Goal fieldOfView for this move

Focal length divided effective aperture diameter indicating width of focal
plane
Distance to focal plane of sharpest focus

Mark start/stop with true/false output respectively useful to trigger
external animations
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress
Text description to be displayed for this CameraMovement
Whether this CameraMovement can be activated
Duration in seconds for this move
Goal camera position for this move
Goal camera rotation for this move
Whether or not camera direction is tracking towards the aimPoint
Goal aimPoint for this move, ignored if tracking=false
Goal fieldOfView for this move

Focal length divided effective aperture diameter indicating width of focal
plane
Distance to focal plane of sharpest focus

Mark start/stop with true/false output respectively useful to trigger
external animations
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo:
OfflineRender defines a parameters for offline rendering of Camera animation
output to a movie file (or possibly a still shot).

field.@appinfo: Text description to be displayed for this OfflineRender
Whether this OfflineRender can be activated
Frames per second recorded for this rendering
Size of frame in number of pixels width and height
Relative dimensions of pixel height/width typically 1.33 or 1
Begin render operation
Progress performing render operation (0..1)
Render operation complete
Format of rendered output movie (mpeg mp4 etc.), use first supported format

Format of rendered output images (png jpeg gif tiff etc.) use first supported
format
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress
Text description to be displayed for this OfflineRender
Whether this OfflineRender can be activated
Frames per second recorded for this rendering
Size of frame in number of pixels width and height
Relative dimensions of pixel height/width typically 1.33 or 1
Begin render operation

Render operation complete

enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress
